I have something rather special for my 5th and last plane. However, I need to spec it out to the latest points tally, which keeps changing.

AI balance isn't quite as good at the moment, so I wouldn't fret too much about the result.

In my signature, it is there. In case: jammer 20

Vulcan 7 

ammo boxes 4

gau 8 14

aim 9 6

aim 120 4

Flare 3

Chaff 2

As they were then, no changes. Good to know.

You can make links clickable by wrapping them in BBcode URL tags btw:

    [url]www.xyz.com[/url]

There's a way to make images clickable too.
I know how to, but I'm on mobile.

Okay, this is my last submission to this challenge.

This time I went a totally different direction, did some homework, and found a plane that was a legendary dogfighter during the Korean War / early Vietnam era.

The F-86E.

![screenshot23_2.png](http://i40.photobucket.com/albums/e216/Max_Payne_0001/screenshot23_2.png)

This particular KSP craft is actually really close to the real thing performance and armament wise. The real plane is a transonic (mach 0.7 to 0.99) fighter with a single jet engine and has a max turning G of 6. This mock-up simulates that fairly close. The major difference is that the real plane had 6 single barrel machine guns (unsure of the calibre) and this mockup has twin Vulcans. I figured that was a good compromise.

The only added bit of options were a single box of flares and chaff. So she's so lean it's anorexic.

31 points total

-2X hidden Vulcans

-3X 20mm rounds

-1X Chaff

-1X flares

[http://www.filehosting.org/file/details/503746/CF-86%20Sabrejet.craft](http://www.filehosting.org/file/details/503746/CF-86%20Sabrejet.craft)

EDIT: Wrong picture. My craft file has 3 boxes of 20mm rounds and two vulcans, not the 4 boxes and 4 vulcans in the picture and the main wings are different. Sorry about that. I'm away from my computer at the moment.
